text: ```Hello, I've a hubdb column with a date: {{ row.bezoekdag_corporate|format_datetime('dd MMMM yyyy') }} - the output is "30 June 2024" but i want to get a weekday printed as well, for example "Monday 6 May 2024". How do i get the weekday printed? Anyone who can help me?```
I think format_date('full') will get you what you want.  Check the options in HubL filters here...   <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/filters>

Hi everyone! Does anyone has any tips on how to reduce the performance impact HubSpot forms have on the page? I know I can defer the JS file loading when loading a form to an external site, but what about forms in HubSpot pages? I'm not loading forms/v2.js, it's handled by HubSpot, and the impact on the page is huuuuuge.

Thanks in advance!

yeah it’s really bad performance. I don’t know why the hubl form tag just outputs javascript to embed/inject the form on the page instead of directly outputting html. but it seriously effects layout shifts and interactivity

It's a good question <@U06T2CXKFTQ>!
Recently, clients have been reaching out to us about the performance of their websites on HubSpot. I wish we had more control over the code that HubSpot generates. Sometimes, there's no way we can fix what's coming from HubSpot, and need to compromise on other parts of the website in order to meet the performance KPIs

Especially if there is a cookie banner added, chatbot, forms etc., it's getting rather damaging to the core web vitals on Google speed test

<@U7SL518D6> <@UD53A9UUR>, I'm wondering whether the dev team is aware of these issues and whether there are any plans to address them in upcoming updates. Thanks!
